CatDescriptText: Charles Ward, Fifth Ward, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I wouldn't say anything too good to him, because I think that he's no good. He doesn't mean this country any good.  And furthermore, I don't think that he's doing everything that he says he's doing.  I do believe that he's bluffing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Ward wearing cap, eyeglasses, striped sweater, dark jacket with U.S. Streel lapel pin, and holding pipe, posed in front of building, Downtown
